divs: sighting detailsnovember 13, 2007 approximately 11:30 pm on an unseasonably warm fall night. http:\\img250.imageshack.us\img250\585\ufopsdyc2.jpg that is the crude drawing i made of what i saw about 10 minutes after seeing it. i was at my friend's house, a few of us got together to play some ping pong and hang out. none of us were drinking or using drugs. everyone else was inside and it was me and my friend matt outside having a smoke and talking about college football. i was standing on the ground in the yard angled toward him, he was on the back porch facing away from the house and away from what i saw. i just noticed the formation out of the corner of my eye as i was smoking a cigarette and then i turned toward it to my left. as soon as i saw it i pointed at the sky and yelled "what the #^#$ is that dude?" he was facing the other direction, up on a porch, and in that 1-2 second span that it took him to get down off the porch the lights got smaller until they disappeared completely. he did not get to see them. he knew that i was serious though from my tone of voice and expression when i said something like "they were in formation!" the lights were not high above my head, they were well above the horizon, probably about halfway from the horizon to the top of the sky. they were small and elongated horizontally. they were not crisp edges like in my drawing, they were sort of radiating and blurred around the edges. there were 7 or 8 of them, i am not sure if there was just one light at the top of the formation. the way they disappeared was almost like a "fizzle". they shrank to pinpoints from their original flared appearance and then disappeared completely. i should note that unlike in my rough drawing these lights were exactly perfect in relation to one another - meaning, all distances between and across were perfectly measured. they were all exactly the same size. also, i cannot say for sure whether or not they were moving because i only viewed them for a few seconds at best. they could have been moving very slowly as i saw them. i am actually inclined to believe that they were moving very slowly. i live very close to the 45th parallel in northern michigan, near lake huron. these lights were exactly south.
